title: Efficient Continual Learning in Keyword Spotting using Binary Neural Networks
author: Quynh Nguyen-Phuong Vu (Department of Computer and Electrical Engineering, Mid Sweden University), Luciano Sebastian Martinez-Rau (Department of Computer and Electrical Engineering, Mid Sweden University), Yuxuan Zhang (Department of Computer and Electrical Engineering, Mid Sweden University), Nho-Duc Tran (Department of Computer and Electrical Engineering, Mid Sweden University), Bengt Oelmann (Department of Computer and Electrical Engineering, Mid Sweden University), Michele Magno (Department of Information Technology and Electrical Engineering, ETH Zurich), Sebastian Bader (Department of Computer and Electrical Engineering, Mid Sweden University)
relevance_why: The use of Binary Neural Networks (BNNs) for continual learning in keyword spotting aligns with Haohe's interest in audio and speech processing, allowing for resource-efficient implementations of machine learning models in low-power devices.
background: Keyword spotting: a system designed to detect specific spoken words or phrases, often requiring continual updates to recognize new commands without losing previously learned ones.
contribution: This paper introduces a continual learning framework for keyword spotting using Binary Neural Networks (BNNs), achieving high accuracy in recognizing an evolving set of keywords while efficiently utilizing computational resources.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous models were often static and lacked the capability to adapt to new keywords without retraining or large memory overhead.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work combines resource-efficient continual learning algorithms with BNNs, maintaining performance on both existing and newly introduced keywords while using significantly fewer computational resources.

key_innovation: The integration of continual learning techniques into a BNN framework specifically designed for keyword spotting enables seamless learning of new classes without requiring excessive memory or computation.
real_world_impact: Offers a practical solution for implementing adaptable voice interfaces on resource-constrained devices, enhancing the usability of smart devices across various applications.

new_terms.Binary Neural Networks: **Binary Neural Networks (BNNs)** are neural networks in which both weights and activations are constrained to binary values, greatly reducing computational and memory requirements.
new_terms.Continual Learning: **Continual Learning** refers to the capability of a model to learn from the data in a non-stationary manner without forgetting its previously learned knowledge.
